required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy of PAP Therapy on Reducing AF Recurrence in Patients With Morbidity of OSA
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy of PAP Therapy on Reducing AF Recurrence in Patients With Morbidity of OSA: a Clinical Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to test the effectiveness of positive airway pressure therapy on reducing clinical failure after rhythm control treatment and restoring with regular heart beat in atrial fibrillation patients with obstructive sleep apnea.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to test the effectiveness of positive airway pressure therapy on reducing clinical failure after rhythm control treatment and restoring with regular heart beat in atrial fibrillation patients with obstructive sleep apnea. The study is designed as a multi-center randomized control trial, which plans to recruit 129 atrial fibrillation patients with obstructive sleep apnea (86 in the intervention group with atrial fibrillation standard care and positive airway pressure therapy, 43 in the control group with atrial fibrillation standard care but no positive airway pressure therapy). The subjects will in total visit the hospital 4 times during their 6 months follow-up period, at baseline, 1st, 3rd, and 6th month. Subjects will undergo questionnaire surveys and medical examinations at each visit. The primary objective is to compare after 6months, the clinical failure rate between the group with positive airway pressure therapy and the group with no positive airway pressure therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with documented AFib recurrence
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the event occurs, up to 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is number of participants with documented clinical failure. The documented clinical failure is defined as fulfilling any one of the following situations: documented recurrence of atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter or atrial tachycardia (lasting more than 30 seconds), new prescription of antiarrhythmic drugs (class I or III), repeat ablation (for patients underwent ablation at baseline) or new ablation (for patients used antiarrhythmic drugs for rhythm control at baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in atrial fibrillation burden at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Atrial fibrillation burden from baseline to 6 months will be tested by single-lead ECG, calculated by total time in AF divided by the total time in sinus rhythm

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in self-rated AF symptoms at 1 month, 3 months and 6 months.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, the 1st month, 3rd month and 6th month.
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rated AF symptoms will be tested with the modified EHRA Symptom Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in quality of life at 3 months and 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be tested with EQ-5D questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in daytime sleepiness at 1 month, 3 months and 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Sleepiness will be tested with the Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the event occurs, up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Other cardiovascular events will be diagnosed and recorded by physicians.

arm_group.description: This arm will consist of 86 subjects.
This arm will consist of 43 subjects.

intervention.description: This study intends to investigate effect of PAP therapy on reducing AF recurrence rate in the patients in co-morbidity of OSA. The study will use 2 investigational devices: Philips DreamStation and Philips EncoreAnywhere. Philips DreamStation is used as the PAP therapy device to provide PAP therapy on the study subjects; Philips EncoreAnywhere is used as a telemonitoring service to provide monitoring by physicians that ensure good adherence to PAP. In addition, subjects in the intervention group will also receive AFib standard management and OSA general care.

intervention.intervention_name: AF standard management and OSA general care
intervention.description: Subjects in the control group will receive AF standard management and OSA general care. The treatment, medical care, and AF management for the subjects will be performed at the study hospitals following the newly updated Chinese AF management guideline 'Current knowledge and management recommendations of atrial fibrillation: 2018'.All subjects including the intervention group and the control group will receive the education materials to understand the disease, risk, and management of OSA. All subjects will also receive the general intervention for OSA, including suggestions for body weight control, smoking cessation, alcohol limiting, lateral position sleep, etc.
